intro: Ewyckia tuberculata, commonly known as the roughleaf lily, is a flowering plant native to the temperate regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its strap-shaped, often hairy leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, or red, typically in late summer. Ewyckia tuberculata is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
